noun.description: The state of having, owning, or controlling something.
examples: he had taken possession of one of the sofas
the book came into my possession
are you in possession of any items over $500 in value?

noun.description: An item of property; something belonging to one.
examples: I was alone with no money or possessions
that photograph was Bert's most precious possession

noun.description: The state of being controlled by a demon or spirit.
examples: they prayed for protection against demonic possession

origin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin possessio(n-), from the verb possidere (see possess).
